trans-unit.source: Implement to participate in the creation or choosing of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext?displayProperty=fullName> object, especially to enable shared sessions.
Implement the IInstanceContextProvider interface to provide the appropriate <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext?displayProperty=fullName> object to the system.
Typically, this interface is implemented to support shared sessions, enable service instance pooling, control lifetimes of service instances, or to group contexts among clients.
For example, to implement sharing, insert a custom IInstanceContextProvider to decide which session or call from a client is associated with which <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object.
For an example that demonstrates the sharing of instance contexts, see [InstanceContextSharing](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4a6a46d7-b7d7-4bb5-a0dd-03ffa3cbc230).

> [!NOTE] > When an IInstanceContextProvider is inserted into [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], the normal property that controls the creation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> objects (the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute.InstanceContextMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property) is no longer checked and has no effect.

A more generic mechanism by which you can initialize <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> objects when created (for example, to attach custom extensions to each <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext>) is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextInitializer?displayProperty=fullName>.
Called when a new message is received.
The GetExistingInstanceContext method is called when a message is received.
Return the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object that you want to process the message, or `null`.

In the case of `null`, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object for the message and then calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.InitializeInstanceContext%2A> method.

If you return `null`, the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object goes through the throttling system and increments the count of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ServiceThrottle.MaxConcurrentInstances%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The incoming message.
The channel that received the message.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext?displayProperty=fullName> object that is used to process the message; return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] to create a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object.
Called when <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is returned from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.GetExistingInstanceContext*> method.

InitializeInstanceContext is called when <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.GetExistingInstanceContext%2A> returns `null` and a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object is created.
This method is called to notify you that a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> has been created.
The new <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext?displayProperty=fullName> object.
The incoming message.
The channel that received the message.
Called when all <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> activities have completed to enable implementers to prevent the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> from being recycled.

IsIdle is called when [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is about to close and recycle an idle <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object so that you can inform the runtime whether to continue doing so.
For an example that demonstrates the sharing of instance contexts, see [InstanceContextSharing](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4a6a46d7-b7d7-4bb5-a0dd-03ffa3cbc230).
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object that is considered idle.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is to close and recycle the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object and adjust the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ServiceThrottle.MaxConcurrentInstances%2A?displayProperty=fullName>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Called when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.IsIdle*> method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to enable implementers to provide a callback to notify [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object is finished.

The NotifyIdle method is called when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.IsIdle%2A> method returns `false` to enable you to provide [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.InstanceContextIdleCallback?displayProperty=fullName> object that you use to inform the runtime that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> has finished its work.

When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.InstanceContextIdleCallback?displayProperty=fullName> object notifies the runtime that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> has finished its work, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.IsIdle%2A> once again.
This cycle continues until <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IInstanceContextProvider.IsIdle%2A> returns `true` and the context is closed and recycled.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.InstanceContextIdleCallback"></xref> object that notifies [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> object is to be closed and recycled.
The current <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext>.
